summary: The study uses machine learning to enhance directed protein evolution, reducing experimental effort and increasing throughput by predicting functional enzyme variants.
key_claims: Machine learning-assisted directed evolution finds variants with higher fitness than other approaches.
The approach predicted libraries enriched in functional enzymes and fixed seven mutations in two rounds of evolution.
